content.rendered:
Responsibilities:

As a member of an Agile Scrum team/ Testing Team (waterfall) to execute automation strategy and solution across the application stack. 

  • Create automated tests utilizing standard languages and frameworks, along with supporting data and environment configurations to meet targets
  • Collaborate with DevOps and other cross-functional teams to implement continuous testing through a common DevOps – Test orchestration layer
  • Develop deep understanding of the underlying architecture, backend processes, databases and technology platform of the applications that are being tested
  • Help improve and extend Automated testing strategies and capabilities, and research tools and solutions to streamline or eliminate manual processes wherever possible
  • Experience with Cloud based CICD pipelines highly desired.

Eggplant experience is highly desired.

OSI Overview: 

Optimal Solutions, Inc. (OSI) is a small, disadvantaged business and certified Capability Maturity Model Integration (CMMI) for Development (DEV) Level 3, International Organization for Standardization (ISO) 9001:2015, and ISO 27001:2013. We are a pure-play Agile development firm and an Amazon Web Services (AWS) Public Sector Select Tier Partner. OSI supports the U.S. Army; PEO Soldier at Fort Belvoir, US Army Soldier Institute at Fort Jackson, Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) Hosting and Compute Center providing Application, Middleware, Network and Database administration for Sustainment services at Maxwell Airforce Base (AL), Tinker Airforce Base (OK), Hill Airforce Base (UT) and, at Mechanicsburg (PA), Department of Veterans Affairs. OSI brings extensive experience in Agile Project Management, Cloud Engineering, Microservices Architecture, expertise managing containerized applications on-premises, and Cloud using Kubernetes, modernizing monolithic applications, and migrating workloads to GovCloud by implementing a successful DevSecOps pipeline.  

Program Overview:

Power Control Management Subsystems (PCMS) is a new system being developed by the US ARMY – Space Force to improve wideband satellite communications and operations.  The new system will help the agency plan, manage, and control satellite communications capabilities, maximizing the availability of Wideband (WGS and DSCS, and future Wideband Systems) resources throughout the world.  Users of PCMS will have the ability to perform configuration changes and improve reaction times necessary to overcome SATCOM degradation. Other features include providing near real-time situational awareness to command centers from locations around the world as well as the ability to control signal strength and frequencies to ensure communications among forces are fully optimized.   

Education:

  • Bachelor’s Degree
  •  10+ years of relevant experience on DoD programs
